definition: to break up and drive off
to cause to spread thin or scatter and gradually vanish
to spend or use up wastefully or foolishly
examples: dissipated the family fortune in reckless business ventures

definition: to break up and scatter or vanish
examples: The clouds dissipated and the sun came out.
The team's early momentum has dissipated.

definition: to be extravagant or dissolute in the pursuit of pleasure, to drink to excess
examples: his extended dissipating of the night before
